instruction: What kinds of spectrum (s) were used in the related research on establishing a model for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting?
Output: The research used the visible-near-infrared (Vis-NIR) spectra of Yali samples for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related research on establishing a model for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting?
Output: Savitzky-Golay Smoothing (SGS), Spectral Standardization (SS), Max-min Normalization (MMN), and Standard Normal Variate Transformation (SNV) were used as spectral feature processing methods in the related research.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the discriminant models in the related research on establishing a model for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the discriminant models for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting is accuracy. The accuracy of the models was reported as 96.88% on the calibration set and 92.71% on the validation set.

instruction: What machine learning models were employed in the related research on establishing a model for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during the commercial sorting process, with the purpose of improving the import and export trade competitiveness of Yali pears?
Output: The machine learning models employed for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during commercial sorting were Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (PLS-DA), Support Vector Machine (SVM), and Convolutional Block Attention Module-Convolutional Neural Networks (CBAM-CNN).

instruction: Can the SGS pretreatment combined with the CBAM-CNN deep learning method, which showed the best performance in the related research on establishing a model for online and real-time discrimination of recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during the commercial sorting process, be considered as a superior spectroscopic method compared to traditional methods for improving the import and export trade competitiveness of Yali pears?
Output: Yes, the SGS pretreatment combined with the CBAM-CNN deep learning method can be considered as a superior spectroscopic method compared to traditional methods for improving the import and export trade competitiveness of Yali pears. The research paper states that this online discriminant model achieved the best performance with high accuracy on the calibration and validation sets. Additionally, the prediction time for a single pear was also within the requirements for online sorting. Therefore, this method can effectively detect recessive insect-affected pests in Yali pears during the commercial sorting process, allowing for real-time and accurate inspection. This would enhance the overall quality control and competitiveness of Yali pears in the import and export trade.
